docs.snippet: Coach Luis Filipe Scolari says he wants Brazil to banish the ghosts of 1950, when his country last hosted the World Cup and lost the final in a defeat that has haunted them ever since.
docs.lead_paragraph: Coach Luis Filipe Scolari says he wants Brazil to banish the ghosts of 1950, when his country last hosted the World Cup and lost the final in a defeat that has haunted them ever since.

headline.main: Scolari Seeks to Banish 1950 Brazil Ghosts
headline.print_headline: Scolari Seeks to Banish 1950 Brazil Ghosts

docs.snippet: Rafael Nadal showed no problem with his tender back in his second match since returning from the injury, defeating fellow Spaniard Albert Montanes 6-1, 6-2 to reach the quarterfinals of the Rio Open on Thursday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Rafael Nadal showed no problem with his tender back in his second match since returning from the injury, defeating fellow Spaniard Albert Montanes 6-1, 6-2 to reach the quarterfinals of the Rio Open on Thursday.

headline.main: Nadal Into Quarterfinals in Rio _ No Back Problems
headline.print_headline: Nadal Into Quarterfinals in Rio _ No Back Problems

docs.snippet: Uruguay coach Oscar Washington Tabarez has given a big hint about the make up of his World Cup squad with the 23 players he has picked for next month's friendly against Austria.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay coach Oscar Washington Tabarez has given a big hint about the make up of his World Cup squad with the 23 players he has picked for next month's friendly against Austria.

headline.main: Uruguay Name Settled 23-Man Squad for Austria Friendly
headline.print_headline: Uruguay Name Settled 23-Man Squad for Austria Friendly

docs.snippet: Mexico's main leftist party has submitted a proposal in the Senate to legalize the medicinal use of marijuana.
docs.lead_paragraph: Mexico's main leftist party has submitted a proposal in the Senate to legalize the medicinal use of marijuana.

headline.main: Mexican Left Proposes Medicinal Use for Marijuana
headline.print_headline: Mexican Left Proposes Medicinal Use for Marijuana

docs.snippet: Everton defender Bryan Oviedo's recovery from a horrific double leg break is "remarkable" and he could be fit to play in Costa Rica's World Cup campaign, manager Roberto Martinez said.
docs.lead_paragraph: Everton defender Bryan Oviedo's recovery from a horrific double leg break is "remarkable" and he could be fit to play in Costa Rica's World Cup campaign, manager Roberto Martinez said.

docs.snippet: Brazil and the European Union agreed on Monday to lay an undersea communications cable from Lisbon to Fortaleza to reduce Brazil's reliance on the United States after Washington spied on Brasilia.
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil and the European Union agreed on Monday to lay an undersea communications cable from Lisbon to Fortaleza to reduce Brazil's reliance on the United States after Washington spied on Brasilia.

headline.main: Brazil, Europe Plan Undersea Cable to Skirt U.S. Spying
headline.print_headline: Brazil, Europe Plan Undersea Cable to Skirt U.S. Spying

docs.snippet: Carlos Paez Vilaro, a self-trained painter, sculptor, screenwriter, musician and architect who championed Afro-Uruguayan Candombe music and dance, created colorful murals in dozens of cities around the world, and built a huge "living sculpture" that...
docs.lead_paragraph: Carlos Paez Vilaro, a self-trained painter, sculptor, screenwriter, musician and architect who championed Afro-Uruguayan Candombe music and dance, created colorful murals in dozens of cities around the world, and built a huge "living sculpture" that became an iconic 50-room hotel, died on Monday. He was 90.

headline.main: Uruguayan Artist Carlos Paez Vilaro Dies at 90
headline.print_headline: Uruguayan Artist Carlos Paez Vilaro Dies at 90

docs.snippet: England manager Roy Hodgson is considering using a psychologist to help his side avoid more penalty heartbreak at the World Cup in Brazil later this year.
docs.lead_paragraph: England manager Roy Hodgson is considering using a psychologist to help his side avoid more penalty heartbreak at the World Cup in Brazil later this year.

headline.main: Hodgson Considers Psychologist to Overcome Penalty Woes
headline.print_headline: Hodgson Considers Psychologist to Overcome Penalty Woes

docs.snippet: Brazil would prefer free-trade talks between the European Union and South American bloc Mercosur to include Argentina, but would be prepared to proceed without its regional ally, according to the head of Brazil's farming confederation.
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil would prefer free-trade talks between the European Union and South American bloc Mercosur to include Argentina, but would be prepared to proceed without its regional ally, according to the head of Brazil's farming confederation.

headline.main: Argentina Could Join EU-Mercosur Trade Deal Later-Brazil Farm Chief
headline.print_headline: Argentina Could Join EU-Mercosur Trade Deal Later-Brazil Farm Chief

docs.snippet: Five more members of a Venezuelan national intelligence agency were arrested on murder charges related to the shooting deaths of two people during anti-government protests, the country's chief prosecutor said Wednesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Five more members of a Venezuelan national intelligence agency were arrested on murder charges related to the shooting deaths of two people during anti-government protests, the country's chief prosecutor said Wednesday.

headline.main: 5 From Domestic Spy Agency Arrested in Venezuela
headline.print_headline: 5 From Domestic Spy Agency Arrested in Venezuela
